Posts.Content: May 1, 2008 01:43PM Vinogal wrote: I too was told right from my initial mamm that it has highly suspicious.....my pcp even went as far as to say 97%....have to admit I have gone into every appt. since with fingers crossed.....keep hoping someone was going to say.....no no no.....this is likely........blah..blah....blah.....get all of my results on Tuesday....then a plan.... good luck with your battle Jax
Posts.Title: diagnosis by mamo and us? leoscat Vinogal

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2009 08:57PM Vinogal wrote: Glad to hear you did well for your first AC.....it is doable.......I thought I would chime in to say that I did all AC and T's.....dose dense and am halfway through herceptin and I never had a port......I also had all nodes removed in the right side so only have one arm available for sticks........stay strong.......you'll be done soon.....good luck Cheers and hugs Jax
Posts.Title: No Port, First Chemo, On With The Show! lizardbreath LRM216

Posts.Content: Vinogal wrote: Well........the wait is over......not sure if I like this any better though......full day on friday with bone scan....chest xrays......and ultrasounds......then preop......I have schedule my lumpectomy for May 15th.......next thursday......so if we get clear margins.....we move on to chemo.....then rads.....I think that's the order she said.....does that sound right to you guys?.....so I have my plan......I know I said I would feel better with a plan......but I was really hoping it wasn't invasive......can someone tell me how soon after chemo starts do you typically lose your hair?.....trying to figure out when to tell the kids.... Thanks to everyone for your support. Jax Dx 4/16/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage II, Grade 3, 1/13 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2009 01:36PM - edited Sep 28, 2009 01:38PM by Vinogal So it's been a year since my last Taxol infusion.....so I thought I would post my hair today......not quite as long as I was hoping for a year out......but it's hair and I'll take it!  pre chemo  short and purple.....couple months out  couple of months later....went a little crazy with some colours!  got some extensions in the front......they didn't last too long!  About 8 months out!  today.....getting there.....can't wait for a pony tail......sorry the pics are so big.......and for those of you with little or no hair right now.......keep the faith......it does come back........and I am sure it's the herceptin that is slowing my growth. Happy hair growing!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2008 11:08AM Vinogal wrote: I am currently sitting with dye on my brand new eyebrows........I am blonde and have always dyed them darker........nice to finally have them back..........just hope they are long enough that the dye will look good.......fingers crossed.......I will know in about 15 more minutes.........I am then thinking about dying my new hair purple with one of those dyes that washes out in 8 washes.......gotta try something.......I am getting so tired of wearing the wig......it seems to be getting more and more uncomfortable the longer my own hair gets.......I am thinking that if it is purple.....people may think I'm just a crazy girl with short purple hair........I bought the bow of colour a couple of weeks ago......and keep thinking should I?......shouldn't I?........I have time today to take 8 showers if I don't like it.......but here's my question........does it really wash out?.......anybody? Cheers Jax

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2008 09:26AM Vinogal wrote: Nancy......congrats on the wigless thing.......I went wigless for the first time at my party on Saturday night.....I had bilat mast yesterday and thought I would wait until after the surgery and christmas to do the big reveal.......but the thought of keeping my wig on all night at my party was too much.......added a few highlights to the now pink hair and voila.......everyone said they liked it......but what are they supposed to say!

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2009 08:21PM Vinogal wrote: Helen.....start with clippers........real simple.......I used to do my son's hair.......before he got too cool for that..........your head may still feel really odd.....I know mine did.......I didn't get relief until my dh shaved it with a razor......just make sure to use a fresh blade.......I certainly wouldn't think it's something you need to spend money on at the salon. Cindy....I use a tiny flat iron to make it stand up and then use gel to get the seperation and then hairspray for staying power......bit of a process........but only takes me less than 5 minutes.......I must admit I miss my long so much.......but this is really easy. Jax
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2009 10:15PM Vinogal wrote: Nodapearl.....they didn't last long....they fell out.....I was told this would be the case......but I was headed to Vegas and just felt like I needed something. Goldie......You look fantastic........you have great growth....so much longer than mine....I was pretty curly before losing it.....came in less curly.....texture is finally feeling better.... I see our diagnosis was around the same time.....but you are HER2-......confirms my theory that the herceptin is slowing things down,.......last one on October 14th......fingers crossed for faster growth! Cheers and hugs to all! Jax

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2008 07:39PM Vinogal wrote: Nancy....I used my husbands stuff......Alberto Extreme Style REWORK......Fibre Putty.......feels like glue......but really works......it's the only stuff that can get my son's hair to stand up......his is super thick.....they call it rework because the idea is you can rework it.......good after wearing a hat......can stick it back up......stays a bit sticky though......went to daughter's dance without the wig.......but kept my hat on the whole time.....baby steps.... Cheers Jax

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2009 09:45AM Vinogal wrote: Not sure about FEC.......but my onc was willing to let me try going without dex for my AC treatments........I figured it was worth a shot........he told me that it was not an option for the Taxol phase....I would have to take it.......but I thought if I could avoid it for 2 months......it was worth a shot.........I never had severe nausea......managed fine with some alternative anti nauseants and was happy to avoid the dex.....maybe it's something you could discuss with her onc. Cheers Jax
